snippet: State and local governments have maintained that the tribe, the Wampanoag Tribe of Gay Head (Aquinnah), forfeited its right to build a casino on the Vineyard in the 1980s when it agreed to a land settlement.
abstract: Wampanoag Indian tribe in Aquinnah, Mass, says it has obtained approval from federal agency to open casino on tribal land on Martha's Vineyard, but state and local governments challenge conclusion, saying tribe forfeited rights in 1980s when it agreed to land settlement.
lead_paragraph: State and local governments have maintained that the tribe, the Wampanoag Tribe of Gay Head (Aquinnah), forfeited its right to build a casino on the Vineyard in the 1980s when it agreed to a land settlement.

headline.main: Tribe Claims Approval for Martha’s Vineyard Casino, Reviving Fight
headline.print_headline: Tribe Claims Approval for Martha’s Vineyard Casino, Reviving Fight
